Description: This is the Lord of the Rings of superhero movies - it's very very long, but that's okay, because it's SO good! Sure, Heath Ledger's Joker easily takes the cake, but I also really love Batman's development and his decision, I like Nolan's art style, love the actors, the plot twists, all the dialogues - in short, there's really nothing I don't like so there is also no other rating I can give.
Title: The Dark Knight

Description: I told my wife halfway through the movie sitting in the cinema: "This is the best thing since our marriage." - and I meant it. I got goosebumps, I cried like a baby in the end, laughed at the funny scenes and shouted approvement when it was necessary. Say what you want, but the MCU is the single best and most epic achievement in pop culture and movie history of all time and Endgame sums it up perfectly. The time travel story brings us to loved scenes from other movies just as well as some quotes and this biggest crossover ever makes me so incredibly happy. I have to admit, there are holes in the logic since everything could've gone way smoother with the existence of Captain Marvel (it's the same problem with every universe that has Superman in it) and that's the only reason I won't give it a 10/10, even if I don't even mind that shortcoming. Love it. It's the awesome finale of something that I loved for more than a decade and that I will continue to love for the rest of my life. Oh, and I loved the all-women get together in the final battle!
Title: Avengers: Endgame

Description: My favorite movie for so long and after re-watching it so many years later it's definitely still up there. Really great origin story, awesome actors with great characters to play in almost every role - they really thought this through comic-style. No unnecessary scenes, everything has a purpose, great lines and great bloody action. I love it, I just love it. Also: One of the best soundtracks and theme songs in this list.
Title: The Punisher

Description: The beginning was surprisingly dramatic, but the movie builds more of a real story than a comedy firework. The single gags in itself have way more quality than in the prequel - especially the extensive after credit scene(s). Some CGI effects could be better, though.
Title: Deadpool 2

Description: Ryan Reynolds IS Deadpool and the character is very similiar to its comic version. We have a nice Wolverine/Hugh Jackman diss, but the story doesn't really moves forward because of all the extensive flashbacks. And for my taste it was also a little bit too much love story.
Title: Deadpool

Description: Surprisingly violent and bloody, but I loved it. Great and dramatic ending for a legendary superhero character / actor combination. And a nice setting/world with an post-apocalyptic feel.
Title: Logan

Description: Constant action with an incredible cast of stars in the ultimate crossover. Maybe the movie is a tiny bit too long and it has an open end with lots of drama that I can't take too seriously (hey, it's a comic adaption - of course nothing is final). It's dark but still funny.
Title: Avengers: Infinity War

Description: Sorry for the rating, but I just love this movie - there's no other I've watched as many times. I love the soundtrack (even if it basically only consists of one song), love the cheesy bad special effects, the weird youngster way Terence Hill is talking, the stupidly funny characters and story... it just makes me smile the whole way through.
Title: Poliziotto superpiù

Description: Awesome and probably timeless CGI, great universe build around lovable characters played by great actors and a simply epic soundtrack and finale.
Title: Guardians of the Galaxy

Description: The only "superhero" with cooler toys than Batman. Awesome monster designs and ruthless atmosphere in general. Love this movie and its direction - even like Keanu Reeves and Shia LaBeouf in this.
Title: Constantine

Description: Visually it's probably the most impressive and most beautiful MARVEL movie to date (with exception of Doctor Strange maybe). In general it has such a great and fresh feel about it with the completely different setting in Africa and with the great combination of tradition and modernity, also in the soundtrack. Love the culture, the gadgets and the characters. I also like the villain very much and his motives, although it's again the typical MARVEL villain. There was Iron-Man vs. evil Iron-Man, Hulk vs. evil Hulk etc - and now there's Black Panther vs. evil Panther. Certainly one thing DC does way better.
Title: Black Panther

Description: That's definitely some other kind of origin story in comparison to the rest of the Marvel Cinematic Universe and also a very other kind of style - you just have to love the Inception-esque CGI effects and Benedict Cumberbatch also does a great job.
Title: Doctor Strange

Description: Even if the first X-Men movie was 2 years earlier, this was the film the started it all for me. Of course there were superheroes before and also live action superheroes, but this one opened the genre for me and made me fall in love with it. I love the origin story, even the love story with the most iconic kissing scene in all of movie history (and probably also the most copied one). And even if I don't like Green Goblin Willem Dafoe made an amazing believable villain. I love how he puts Spider-Man in front of the choice MJ vs. a ropeway full of children... definitely a great villain.
Title: Spider-Man

Description: Another meeting of generations for Patrick Stewart - lucky him! Wolverine as the protagonist always works and it has a cool story, awesome fights and lots of stars.
Title: X-Men: Days of Future Past

Description: It's a really long movie, mostly because there are a lot of flashbacks. Basically every important character in the plot gets its own background story and those are pretty extensive. But surprisingly it doesn't matter, because all of them are interesting. Rorschach is one of the greatest anti heroes out there - even if his moving mask is never explained. It has a great and long superhero sex scene, which is new. And also nice Eastereggs regarding Batman and his parents. Good villain with an interesting goal and definitely a great ending.
Title: Watchmen

Description: It's a really great movie, especially for the MCU. There's so much character development in all of them going on, especially with the underrated Hawkeye getting a focus on, but also the even stronger inner conflict of Banner. Vision, Scarlet Witch and her brother are great additions and so is Ultron as a villain with an interesting motive. There are lots of awesome and funny lines and memorable scenes like the whole discussion about who can wield Thor's hammer and the whole Infinity Stones / Thanos storyline really kicks in. It would be a strong 9, but there are some scenes that were a little dragging - the whole thing just felt a little too long or rather kind of seperated - there are two or three movies in here.
Title: Avengers: Age of Ultron

Description: Love how everytime someone says Stanley I hear Stan Lee. But also love this film in general. Better CGI than in most of the current movies, super entertaining and definitely unique - would've liked to see sequels (but ones with Jim Carrey and the same kind of niveau). Also... the dog <3
Title: The Mask

Description: The first big crossover and for its time it was epic - significantly less now that we know Infinity War, but nontheless a pretty good movie. It's great to see the several conflicts between the heroes, to see SHIELD in all its glory and the MARVEL humor at its best.
Title: The Avengers

Description: Wolverine teaching pick-up lines - perfect! It's a pretty cool start for the series with a focus on the core mutants and their different goals. It also has the most subtle Stan Lee cameo ever and it's weird to see that it's so old already that the Twin Towers still stand. Love Magneto.
Title: X-Men

Description: There are more exciting and funnier superhero movies, but this one kind of started the hype.
Title: Iron Man

Description: Exciting story (the enemy of my enemey is my friend) and Mystique at her best. This movie is what I will always think for first when talking about X-Men.
Title: X2

Description: I just can't see Norton as the egghead he's playing, but special effects and story are superb, even if the villain feels a lot like Iron-Man 1. Great action and great actors.
Title: The Incredible Hulk

Description: Very good mixture of dark and funny with a convincable amazon. Chris Pine is of course very likable in his role, the action is cool but not over the top. The World War doesn't seem whitewashed or belittled and I may be wrong... but is this the first superhero movie with a female protagonist? Why did it take so long?!
Title: Wonder Woman

Description: It's a very long movie with a lot of tiring self-doubt, but I really like the whole plot. Bane isn't The Joker, but he is still a more interesting villain than most and I really love Gotham being turned into a "Escape From New York" kind of prison - although Gotham looked way to obviously like New York (with the One World Center being built). Definitely a good ending for the trilogy.
Title: The Dark Knight Rises

Description: It doesn't really do that much different in comparison to the old movies - uses a lot of the same imagery (e.g. the boxing ring, letting the criminal slip that kills Ben, saving lots of people on a crowded bridge), but I like Andrew Garfield more then Tobey Maguire, I prefer his version of Peter Parker, because it's way more cheeky and I definitely prefer Gwen Stacey to Mary Jane - I just adore the love story here. The villain is rather lame (as is every single one in all of the Spider-Man movies so far...) and The Lizard's face looks absolutely stupid and way too humanoid.
Title: The Amazing Spider-Man

Description: Probably the funniest superhero movie out there with excellent gags, just because they almost overused everything that worked fine in the first one (Baby Groot, Drax's way of speaking). It also looks visually very good, but even if Peter meets his father, the content is rather thin and after the perfect first half hour the story keeps dragging a little.
Title: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2

Description: The Megazords didn't look retro enough for my taste (same goes for the suits for that matter), but the nostalgia hit me like a bomb - and I wasn't even that big of a Power Rangers fan as a kid. Loved all the characters from the start, the setting and the special effects... Only had a little problem with Elizabeth Banks as alien villain, because to me she's the face of Zack and Miri make a Porno.
Title: Power Rangers

Description: A real surprise! For Japanese actors they're pretty cool and the CGI is awesome! Main part of the action are the fights against the Hollows and those monsters look amazing - even better than the original ones from Manga and Anime. The movie is also very true to the original, except for the ending - it leaves room for a sequel but can also be viewed as a standalone. Best anime adaption I've seen so far.
Title: Bleach: Burîchu

Description: Still love the theme song! But why are the Penguin henchman circus themed? Thought that was Joker's thing. The abandoned zoo as headquarters  is significantly more fitting, even if it's a bit too obvious. Also Catwoman as an undead zombie? Very Burton-like. And with that in mind the Frankenstein-costume fits her really good. And I just love her personality which the authors absolutely nailed. What I certainly also love are the many cool and cartoony ideas like the hidden elevator in Bruce's iron maiden or Oswald's remote toy version of the Batmobil or big hangig cages or dressed up soldier penguins. Oswald's costume and makeup is perfect anyway. I think I actually prefer this one over the first.
Title: Batman Returns

Description: Will Smith is one of my favorite actors of all time and I love how Hancock starts - the drunk Superman who insults old women and scares children. It's interesting. It's something new. I don't like him being sad and lonely but he should not have done a complete 360 after one hour to become a boyscout. Nevertheless also an interesting origin story.
Title: Hancock

Description: I don't have much love for the first one, but part 2 was really enjoyable with its Justice League of losers. Hit Girl really grew up ("She grew up. She filled out.") and they kept the fun violence. Nothing that will stay fresh in my memory for too long, but nevertheless very entertaining. Also funny that they changed one grown-up king of overacting (Cage) for another (Carrey) - even if Jim was very down-to-earth in comparison to The Mask for example.
Title: Kick-Ass 2

Description: Really interesting general plot with more magic than science and a great protagonist. Villains could be better, but of course Loki is pretty cool.
Title: Thor

Description: It sure took a while to finish this trilogy, but in my opinion it was worth the wait. Not as good as Split - the highlight still is schizophrenic James McAvoy - but a very solid movie. I love how you're wondering through the whole movie if the superpowers actually exist and that some parts don't really make sense (the psychiatrist could just test if someone is invincible or super strong, right?), but in the end every piece finds it place and works out - in a very good and brave finale. Good job, M. Night Shamalamadingdong - but you really don't have to include your "acting" in any more of your films...
Title: Glass

Description: Andrew Garfield is definitely my favorite Spider-Man so far. I love the Peter Parker he plays, who is extremly cheeky which makes the first 20 minutes of the movie very funny and I also prefer Gwen Stacey over Mary-Jane. I love the courage of the team to make such a dramatic ending, but unfortunately I don't like Electro that much - sure, he is a very frightening super villain but certainly not visually. Also the middle part of the movie is kind of dragging... Other than that I'm very sad to see this series end so abruptly.
Title: The Amazing Spider-Man 2

Description: It continues its really great horror atmosphere with a cool story, that makes Blade cooperate with the vampire council - including Ron "Hellboy" Perlman and Norman Reedus. The CGI improved SO much in comparison to the first part and the martial arts choreographies are superb. Very enjoyable movie.
Title: Blade II

Description: It was fun to see Rocksteady and Bebop included and even Krang was a nice addition, although almost overkill. There was a little too much going on for all the characters to shine on their own - Stephen Amell in his new role for example. It was very entertaining nonetheless with funny quotes (gotta love Mikey) and scenes, good and cool action scenes and in general it wasn't as exaggerated as the first one. I think, I prefer this one.
Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows

Description: He stops villains, he certainly has superpowers and he leaves his symbol like Batman (the whole town even feels like Gotham) - so, sure, he's a superhero. In a way. Anyway, the legendary movie where Bruce Lee's son died on set, gotten hit by an allegedly fake bullet. Besides this, it's fun! It's violent, it has this strong and guitar playing antihero with his crow, fighting his way through this dark and rainy town.
Title: The Crow

Description: It's very long... the beginning is very action-packed but it just takes too long. Nonetheless, epic crossover with epic battle and the introduction of Black Panther as well as the new Spider-Man. It's not as funny as the Avengers movies, but also not as dark as a Batman one.
Title: Captain America: Civil War

Description: Way too much backstory for my taste. I mean, the very long Krypton part and the bits from his childhood on earth were a good introduction to the general history of Superman... but it's the boring Superman after all. I also don't like Zod as a villain very much, but the fight in Smallville was very cool and the apocalyptic feeling in the pretty long finale was kind of epic. VERY difficult to rate!
Title: Man of Steel

Description: Probably my favorite one of the trilogy? Not quite sure yet. Either way, it has too much awkward comedy scenes in the first half, way too much artificially created romance drama all the way through and a really pathetic loser Peter Parker. But it also has the coolest villain of the trilogy (and probably also of all Spider-Man movies so far), the heartbreakingly beautiful train scene and the probably most subtle Stan Lee cameo so far.
Title: Spider-Man 2

Description: Still wondering how they did the small vs. ripped Chris Evans. Didn't like it at all the first time but rather digged it the second. Similiar story to Wonder Woman but not as touching - but nonetheless exciting.
Title: Captain America: The First Avenger

Description: Starts with rather terrible CGI that gets really good in the end. It's more an interesting love story than a typical superhero movie, but nonetheless it's fun to watch. Big surprise.
Title: I Am Number Four

Description: From an artistic point of view and regarding the dialogues it's plain genius. It's a bit too long, but visually stunning and the great mystery around V remains.
Title: V for Vendetta

Description: You really see and feel the Guillermo del Torro in this - some monsters look like they were taken straight from Pan's Labyrinth. I love the style but since Pan is so precious to me, it felt a little weird to see it in Hellboy. Also the fairytale vibe was very del Torro. I liked the new characters - especially the not-stereotypical villain - the story, the dialogues and the new focus on the side characters... but it's not better than the first one. Similarly good, but not better.
Title: Hellboy II: The Golden Army

Description: I like Burton's surrealistic dirty Gotham and I most definitely love the Batmobil - as impractiable as it may be. Not a fan of the useless Commissioner Gordon in comparison to Gary Oldman, but this Alfred is certainly one of the best. Heartpiece of the movie is of course Nicholson's Joker, which is really cool and close to the original, I just don't appreciate his origin story. I prefer that to be unknown and mysterious.
Title: Batman

Description: Watching it for the third time I finally saw how awfully bad Megan Fox acts (she also was never as hot anymore as she seemed in the first Transformers movie) and how shallow cliché the villains were. One of the richest guys in all of America wants to kill millions for even more money? I liked the Turtles - especially Raphael in terms of design and Michelangelo in terms of character and humor, only Donatello's nerd design wasn't really my thing. Will Arnett had only a comic function on the level of any popcorn movie ever, but it worked rather well and the bottom line is, that the movie is quite entertaining and in my opinion certainly a little more than the original rubber suit one.
Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

Description: I didn't expect it at all, but this was really good! The way better Kick-Ass, that turns into a Punisher at the end. Hilarious origin story, some pretty funny scenes and dialogues and even the cut made me laugh sometimes. It had some gory elements and sex was also a topic, but most impressively was the I-knew-almost-every-face-cast: Liv Tyler, Kevin Bacon as another (super)hero villain, Nathan Fillion as the TV superhero The Holy Avenger, Michael Rooker and Sean Gunn were a team here before they reunited in Guardians of the Galaxy, Gregg Henry who played Starlord's Grandfather in the same movie, Linda Cardellini who plays Hawkeye's wife in Age of Ultron, Ellen Page - prominent member of the X-Men cast. This movie was quite the foreshadowing.
Title: Super

Description: Very S.H.I.E.L.D. centered with Nicky Fury, Black Widow and Robert Redford playing a very convincing villain. It establishes a good connection to the Avengers, but at the same time makes the plot illogical (why doesn't they call in Iron-Man to help instead of risking everything by going to somebody else?). But hey, I love secret organisations, so this works very fine for me.
Title: Captain America: The Winter Soldier

Description: Likeable characters and actors (unlike the remake) - especially Captain America is cool, but Alba... she's just in for the looks, can't act at all. CGI could be better but hey, it's old.
Title: Fantastic Four

Description: Good origin story with an incredible cast (Liam Neeson, Christian Bale, Gary Oldman, Morgan Freeman...). Cool and dark Gotham, the best butler ever, but unfortunately not a lot of striking scenes to remember.
Title: Batman Begins

Description: I really like the addition to Magneto's origin story, as well as to see the beginnings of the relationships Magneto-Xavier and Mystique-Xavier. Awesome cameo of Wolverine, but all the other mutants were pretty lame - except for Kevin Bacon, proving after Hollow Man, that he's a pretty good villain.
Title: X: First Class

Description: Well, sure, there are some points that you don't like right away - the new, uglier look of Hellboy... and even worse: Mila Jovovich. But other than that I don't really see why this movie was so badly rated. It's not as funny as the previous ones with Perlman, but Hellboy kept his cool character and works fine, the side characters are good and other than being played by Jovovich even the villain is pretty cool. I love the adventure aspect of the movie and the aestetics are in parts even better than the unusual creatures del Toro provided (those hell monsters in the end are BADASS!). The gore was amazing - this is probably the most violent superhero movie out there - and it was quite enjoyable, only 20-30 minutes too long.
Title: Hellboy

Description: "Come on! Toilets are always funny!" & "We was watching!" So, this basically feel like a Sin City parody, is way less deep and definitely less uniquely stylized, but it's also less tiresome to watch. The famous cast alone is a real blast and some of the scenes and lines are hilariously stupid. The story is okay at best, but I like the characters and the idea of treasures from Greek mythology in the present. Another one of those movies which isn't as bad as ratings and reviews might suggest.
Title: The Spirit

Description: More Tony Stark than Iron Man, but also more story and humour than part 2.
Title: Iron Man Three

Description: Pure 80s goodness: great trashy splatter effects, fancy music, naked breasts and hilarious characters. I watched the fourth part years ago and it was horrible, but this is a very solid movie that I'd definitely rewatch - especially because there are great hidden gold moments like katanas on the wall of an authentic Mexican restaurant :D
Title: The Toxic Avenger

Description: It was good enough for me to feel bad about not hearing of it earlier. Great actors, nice atmosphere, only the basic story and the protagonist were a little uninspired. At least the crowdfunding brought in enough money for great visuals. More a superpower than a superhero story.
Title: Code 8

Description: Interesting and unconventional superhero story, that unfortunately ends when it comes to the best part. So it's basically too much origin story, not enough real plot, but nonetheless has a very good ending.
Title: Unbreakable

Description: What's up with the 80s soundtrack? Still not sure if I like that in a Thor movie or not... Well, I guess it levels the way for his meeting with the Guardians. Incredibly funny cameo of Matt Damon as Loki, memorable crossover with the Hulk, packed in a cool story, that's a bit too often too silly.
Title: Thor: Ragnarok

Description: I liked this one better than the first, even if I dearly missed Eva Mendes! The CGI was pretty good, the director had some really interesting style choices and Cage's overacting especially during the transformation were spot-on. Also it continues its way of humor, where the film doesn't take itself too serious with some pretty good and not cheesey one-liners. The story was okay and I love Ghost Rider transforming other vehicles like a bucket excavator into flaming death machines.
Title: Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance

Description: This kind of feels like (Old Man) Logan - unusual Setting, basically only Logan without any of the X-Men and Wolverine in a weakened condition. I love Japan so I really appreciated the change from Marvel-USA. The story was interesting too - especially the past part with Logan witnessing the Nagasaki bomb. The general story drags on a bit too long and I'm not a fan of the armor in the end, but there are a lot of fun kungfu and katana fights. Unfortunately, they're not bloody - a little touch (Old Man) Logan would've done wonders.
Title: The Wolverine

Description: Jeez, Ryan Reynolds really is handsome. Anyway, I don't get why everyone is hating this movie so much - the CGI was average at best but other than that? Likeable actors and characters, an okay story (the cloud villain isn't really my thing but was also okay in Dr. Strange - so why not here?) and some of the dialogues were actually funny. An entertaining movie about a superhero with one of the coolest superpowers ever!
Title: Green Lantern

Description: Don't know why this movie is rated so poorly - it's definitely a rock-solid action movie with a lot of budget. A little bit over the top sometimes ("From now on, call me... Commander"), but that didn't bother me. And Sienna Miller is pretty hot with dark hair.
Title: G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra

Description: The looks and the story are very Disney - but also the budget and the actors (woohoo, Bruce Campbell! :) ). Typical highschool (love & fame) story, just with superpowers.
Title: Sky High

Description: Again Iron Man vs. another Iron Man?
Title: Iron Man 2

Description: Very bad CGI, but pretty cool atmosphere and gore. Still feels very 80s.
Title: Blade

Description: Again, Ant-Man really doesn't feel like part of the Marvel cinematic universe at all - the more I was surprised by the awesome aftercredit scene (at least the first one). And again, it was an entertaining movie with funny ideas and scenes, but without anything really memorable. But I like the Wasp - she is the way better and way prettier Ant-Man.
Title: Ant-Man and the Wasp

Description: It was actually not as bad as I had expected. I mean sure, the origin story took - Bollywood-style musical parts included - almost two full hours and it can't be taken seriously, but it sure was entertaining with likeable characters and actors and funny special effects. Better than Hentai Kamen for sure.
Title: Krrish

Description: Certainly a fun movie with an authentic looking Venom - unlike the thin teenage version in Spider-Man 3... I like the story and the schizophrenic dialogue between Eddie and his symbiont, although it's weird to see Venom basically as a good guy. Good start for the Sony's Universe of Marvel Characters with a dark atmosphere but also good laughs.
Title: Venom

Description: Likeable movie with some great scenes (especially the fight involving Thomas the Tank Engine of course) and cool characters, even if cries out comedy was more than all the other marvel movies do. It also feels kind of separated and again there's the story of good superhero fights against bad supervillain with the same powers, but it's enjoyable nonetheless.
Title: Ant-Man

Description: Typical American movie playing in Europe - do ALL the sightseeing all over the place, as if one couldn't fill the movie otherwise. Other than that - sure, Peter is a lot more Teenie than any of the other superheroes and therefore it's less serious but I actually enjoy this difference a lot. Liked the teenie love story, especially liked the villain - only downside that I already knew him from the 90s cartoons so the biggest surprise in the movie didn't work for me. Not really good, but pretty enjoyable.
Title: Spider-Man: Far from Home

Description: It was okay. I loved the 90s soundtrack, although the songs were just thrown in for the sake of it - it was no art like in Guardians of the Galaxy. For being the most powerful hero in the Marvel universe she has a rather lame origin story - although her costume is pretty dope. Fury's origin story was way more interesting, in fact - although there was a lot of potential lost here too (the losing-the-eye part could've become a way more entertaining running gag). In short: The movie was enjoyable but it didn't feel as important as it should've at all.
Title: Captain Marvel

Description: Cringe summarizes this movie pretty good, I think, but I had to grin at least halfway through. It's fine to skip the first half hour, but then it gets so weird and stupid and funny, that I just might almost love it :D Bad actors, horrible shaky camera, basically no story, but it has it's very own charme.
Title: Rat Pfink a Boo Boo

Description: Charlize is continuing to rock the short hair while being immortal. Great shootout and thrilling fighting choreographies, but I feel like they missed to make way more out of the immortal protagonists. They must've had an exciting life over the centuries, but you barely get a feel for any of them. It was entertaining, but not ultimately gripping.
Title: The Old Guard

Description: This is basically the prequel to the prequel sequences in X-Men 2 and I actually quite like the story. The CGI could be better (his claws look very fake), I don't get why Gambit helps Victor and even if Wade was very cool in the beginning, this version of Deadpool is just a very poor joke - and I said this already back in 2009 when I didn't even know who Deadpool was supposed to be.
Title: X-Men Origins: Wolverine

Description: I have to admit - I only watched this to see the sex scene with Matthias Schweighöfer's girlfriend (and it was worth it!), but then quickly got to like the colorful comic characters with their unique designs. The story is pretty flat, but the action is nice and if the Punisher fits in this list, so does Polar.
Title: Polar

Description: It didn't have enough money or technology to be great but it was certainly enough to make a rather good movie. It entertained more with its story, which had to be richer since there wasn't too much action. Captain's costume looks a bit too much like a selfmade Halloween costume but the scenes with the shield work rather well... And I like Red Skull, even if it was weird to see him send his normal daughter after his archenemy. Oh, and Kim Gillingham was hot as Sharon, even if she plays the daughter of Steve's actual love interest.
Title: Captain America

Description: The Iron-Man before Iron-Man (movies) - and he hits every damn gasoline truck in the whole film. Takes place in 1938 with a pretty iconic hitman, but a very lame villain and lots of all-fixing chewing gum. Feels more like a non-comedy Supercop (Terence Hill) than a superhero movie from today, but it's likeable. 80s-likeable.
Title: The Rocketeer

Description: Feels undeniably like a Harry Potter, but Percy has definitely superpowers so he's a superhero... I guess? At least Alexandra Daddario is the way hotter Hermione. For me, this movie is too much going from boss fight to boss fight without a lot of story in between - but it's a film adaption of a book, so like always we only get the highlights.
Title: Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Lightning Thief

Description: Similiar to The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen Van Helsing uses characters from old literature and film (Frankenstein, Dracula, Jekyll & Hyde) - just that CGI Mr. Hyde looks like a character from Shrek. Everything feels like a antique fantasy/horror version of James Bond with the Vatican being the equivalent of MI6. And Kate Beckinsale is also a high class Bond girl...
Title: Van Helsing

Description: It's always funny to me when the same actor plays 2 different characters in basically the same universe. Not so funny, that they rebooted the Punisher after the Tom Jane one (which is one of my favorite movies of all time). Love the coldblooded violence, although the splatter effects aren't very good. Liked it more the second time.
Title: Punisher: War Zone

Description: Finally some other kind of beginning for Spider-Man (the spider bite already happened, Parker is still very young), but the middle part of the movie is very unsatisfying and the excitement not on a very high level. The Tony Stark and Captain America cameos are little highlights.
Title: Spider-Man: Homecoming

Description: Come on guys, the movie wasn't that bad! The worst part is the unfinished cliffhanger story without any sequel ever, followed by the not very talented main actor and the stupid bending choreographies - but other than that it looked pretty good and was entertaining on a Narnia level. I certainly would've watched a second movie. (Didn't see the TV show, maybe that's where the hate comes from)
Title: The Last Airbender

Description: The villains weren't villany enough! The movie completely lives of Smith and Margot, even if the weird Joker is pretty scary. The promising style from the coverart and the trailer wasn't crazy enough, the villain maybe not the best pick. I also can't take the city-wide apocalypse very seriously, but nonetheless I had quite fun watching it.
Title: Suicide Squad

Description: There was so much negative fuss about this movie that I was actually afraid to watch it - but protected by all these negative expectations I actually quite enjoyed it. It doesn't belong among the best or even better X-Men movies, but it's certainly not horrible - just nothing special or memorable. The alien enemies are pretty one-dimensional and the whole self doubt thing repeats itself over and over again in the X-Men universe, but it's an enjoyable no-brainer.
Title: Dark Phoenix

Description: It surely has quite some 80s charme, but - and I can't believe I'm saying this - Dolph Lundgren had too much of a baby face in this for Frank Castle. It's an okay movie with some good lines, likeable characters (like the actor talking in rhymes), but also very badly cut action scenes, not nearly enough blood and gore and it feels a bit slow. One more Punisher who didn't make it to a sequel.
Title: The Punisher

Description: A German (superhero) movie - that alone should've been enough to make me run, but I needed it for my list here so I stayed. And it was okay - for it being so very obviously German. The actors were okay - for being German - and the few effects were also fine. The story on the other hand felt more like some old German director heard of superhero movies trending, but he started producing/writing before seeing a single one. It was interesting in a way, though, because it certainly is different in many ways.
Title: Freaks: You're One of Us

Description: Well, I'm sure it was somewhat revolutionary back then and it didn't age as bad as other movies, but nonetheless it's not really that good. Clark is a little too clumsy, Lois way too in awkward teenie love with Superman and way too damsel in distress and Lex with his team of idiots is as stereotypical as a villain as he can get with wanting to let the whole west coast sink into the ocean to make profit with the desert land that would be the new coast. Also the ending makes the whole universe bullshit, because if it would be so easy to turn back time, basically no threat would make sense. At least it has the iconic interview romance scene.
Title: Superman

Description: It certainly has its nostalgic charme, but in the end it's really just a 90s kids movie. I'm surprised how well the fighting worked in those chunky costumes! And one more point: The different personalities of the Turtles definitely came out better in the newer CGI remake, which I have to admit, I like a bit better... Shame on me, I know.
Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

Description: Now I even watch subtitled Korean movies for this list! It was... okay, I guess? The special effects are on an above average Japanese level and the story is pretty run-of-the-mill. But I really like the overacting villains and the not so typical protagonist, whose facial expressions are awkwardly funny.
Title: Yeom-lyeok

Description: The cast was great (except for the extended Casey Neistat cameo maybe :D) and the special effects just as well, but the story was very linear and predictable - your typical Netflix produced headliner. It was okay as a one-time evening watch, but other than that nothing really special.
Title: Project Power

Description: Well, here's something I found by accident. A superhero movie made in Denmark. A little kid gets bitten by a scientifically altered ant and develops basically the same powers as Spider-Man - the kid is also an equally big loser as Peter Parker, but he doesn't even know science. He has a sidekick with the most badass tidy nerd room ever and a disgusting weird enemy named The Flea. Cause why not? Well, it's a movie for children so I try not to be too harsh to it - it was actually pretty okay.
Title: Antboy

Description: It was the worst X-Men movie in my memory - after rewatching it I certainly felt better about it but definitely not good enough - it's still the worst one of all of them. The story gets rid of Professor X, Cyclops and Mystique very early one, undoubtely some of the most interesting characters in this universe but brings back Phoenix, who had a great and heroic death in the previous movie. There are a lot of characters and lots of action, but nothing is really great, not even Wolverine or Magneto.
Title: X-Men: The Last Stand

Description: This time the superheroes come from different kind of books - and it's this change and their unusual personalities that make the gentlemen interesting. The technologies are a bit over the top for that era, similiar to the ones used in Wild Wild West, but at least they look well done. The plot twists are ridiculous but not really bad - just as some of the character designs. (Also: Why do you run towards a sword fighter with a rifle in hand, grunts?)
Title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen

Description: Very slow beginning, but in general almost equally stupid-funny as Hentai Kamen - just with more funny-bad CGI.
Title: Zebraman

Description: "Hong Kong's answer to the X-Men trilogy" the cover says. Not quite, but there certainly is worse. The protagonists mutate while being exposed to an old military gas experiment. The evil ones turn strong and fast but also ugly, the hero keeps his appearance in addition to his new powers so he can get the girl. The story is nothing too special, but I like the funny protagonist and the CGI effects are also okay - except for the Asian movie typical flying on ropes jumps and falls. Nothing you have to see, but also nothing you have to regret.
Title: Chun sing gai bei

Description: Chris Evans already was The Torch and Captain America, why not let him be The Pusher, too? I like the world building of these several kinds of superpowers and that no-one apparently uses them to become a real superhero - it's more like in the show "Heroes" where everyone has their own goals. The general story wasn't that thrilling sadly and apart from some clever plot twists regarding future telling it didn't really have any highlights. But at least there were a lot of well-known faces in this - although Evans and Dakota Fanning were pretty much the only well-known names.
Title: Push

Description: Too bad that the Disney take-over couldn't wait a little longer, because the movie could've been so much more - espcially so much more like the much darker trailer. The last fifth is great with lots of action, great special effects and even great horror elements - but everything before that? It was so damn boring and pointless. You really feel, that the whole movie has no real direction or idea what it wants to be. Horror? Breakfast Club? Superhero movie? In the end it's all and nothing of the above. Sad ending for the X-Men series.
Title: The New Mutants

Description: Not just the first superhero from Indonesia I've seen, but probably the first movie ever from there. The story is rather stupid from a reasonable standpoint but I've seen worse. I've also seen worse actors - the protagonist Estelle Linden plays fine and looks good, US import Matthew Settle already played in Gilmore Girls and Band of Brothers. The villain was pretty much cliché, but I liked the mask and there was lots of action, even if the cutting was so quick and often rather bad, that you just knew that no fighting sequence held longer than a few seconds. Also they missed quite a few sound effects in the English dub.
Title: Valentine
Directors: Agus Hermansyah Mawardy, Ubay Fox, Agus Pestol

Description: I always love me some mysterious center of the earth stories, but this one was very simple. It's less a good vs. bad story, not so much hero against villain, it's more about moral - people being afraid of something they don't know and answering it with hatred and violence. And anyway, in my opinion, the Mole Men certainly don't look horrible enough to cause a heart attack - they're almost cute... It's a good story about the cruelty and stupidity of people and with less than 50 minutes it's too short to get boring, but it certainly is also no must-see. It has also very little Superman in it...
Title: Superman and the Mole-Men
Genres: Action, Adventure, Drama, Family, Fantasy, Romance, Sci-Fi

Description: Boring villain in one of the most expensive movies of all time - which you don't see in any minute of it. DC tried successfully to implement the Marvel humour, which is good. Flash being a weird bean-pole and Batman too fat for his costume, the movie really relies on Wonder Woman and Aquaman. Also not very exciting, cause you know from the beginning, how everything will play out.
Title: Justice League

Description: Awesome soundtrack! The beginning is a bit dull and the jumps are too obviously supported by cables, but I really liked how they visually presented the blindness. I love Colin Farrel as Bullseye, only the Kingpin is way cooler in the Netflix series.
Title: Daredevil

Description: The king of overacting plays Ghost Rider together with the hottest Marvel Girl ever. The story base is pretty interesting, but the actual story, the dialogues and even the directing is trashy and cheesy as hell. Not even Nic Cage could take this role seriously.
Title: Ghost Rider

Description: Elves are the enemy - really? Lokis illusions are fun, as well as the cameos of Stan Lee and Captain America, and the destruction of Asgard is exciting, but the story is kind of trivial.
Title: Thor: The Dark World

Description: Jeez, I hate the protagonist. Sure, he has it hard, but he also brings it on himself and all this extreme self-pity is tiring. This is basically Blair Witch Project or any other hand camera (horror) movie, only with superpowers. I have to admit, the finale is pretty epic but until then it's not too much fun... although it can also show what happens, if someone unstable gets huge powers.
Title: Chronicle

Description: Apparently a parody of the Tobey Maguire Spider-Man 2 - incredibly silly, way too long and with a dragging beginning.
Title: HK: Hentai Kamen - Abnormal Crisis

Description: The whole first 15 minutes have more awkward cartoony scenes already than should be in any movie at all. And in continues with Jim Carrey acting just as over the top as in The Mask. Oh, and don't forget the nipples on Batman's costume. And the ass close-up while dressing up! The movie impressed me significantly more as a child in the 90s, but today? I can't really overlook the bad Two Face-makeup, although I always appreciate a film with so many well-known stars. Two-Face and Riddler seem way too similar in this, so bottom-line is: I don't like the style of the director, even if he used The Offspring for his soundtrack.
Title: Batman Forever

Description: Not overly funny but very trashy in a good way. It could have had more dirty jokes like the ducks with breasts in the beginning and Howard definitely needed more character, but it was okay to watch. You definitely have to watch it after Howard's cameo in Guardians of the Galaxy.
Title: Howard the Duck

Description: Steel really reminds me of Wheatley from Portal 2... Anyway, the battles in the armor weren't very exciting and looked a bit like something out of the Power Rangers TV show. And the love story was - even for Hollywood - unrealistically fast.
Title: Max Steel

Description: I like the idea behind the hero, who's turning from a boy into that strong grown man, but in the end I'm not a huge fan of the movie. The old wizard looked SO fake with his beard and long grey hair (why would you not just use an old actor to portray this role?!), the Seven Sins looked like almost identical monsters from a child's nightmare, the villain was so cliché that it hurt. I like the childish attitude, but it didn't work as well as for example Hancock being an asshole. But I appreciate the guest appearances of Ross Butler from Riverdale, D.J. Cotrona from G.I. Joe and Adam Brody, which all have some earlier relation to superheroes or comics. And I appreciate the movie playing in a real DC universe with Batman, Superman & Co.
Title: Shazam!

Description: If this film is one thing, it's awkward - and that a lot. Well, it's from a time when the Comics also still where awkward and colorful instead of dark and serious. Take just the Joker - he looks like a senile clown who is wondering what he's doing there all the time. Also Robin is pathetic enough, but the acting for him in this is just horribly / comically overacted. Everything is so silly, especially the Batman equipment, consistently named something like Batpole or Batladder. It's also weird to see Batman & Robin deputized and not chased by the police. And those costumes! Jeezus - did they have to do them theirselves?! And of course there are puurrfect Catwoman puns. And giant flying umbrellas for Penguin to ride on. Also those dummy "special effects" and the rubber shark in the beginning. And the bad wallpapered sky in the background of the submarine fight. Oh, the list is endless. "Some days you just can't get rid of a bomb."
Title: Batman: The Movie

Description: Coming back to this after years it's even worse. Sure, there are the real horrible scenes that stick with you forever - like the awkward emo dance scene on the street or the gigantic USA flag - but there's so much more. There are the first 45 minutes during which absolutely nothing is happening, then there is the horrible origin story of the Sandman, especially because it stupidly rewrites the whole Uncle Ben plot. Harry as Green Goblin is bad and Venom an absolute joke - my favorite Marvel villain becomes this sorry-ass skinny glibber-thing... Horrible! Also the ending? Horrible. Don't even know if it's worth the 5/10 I'm giving it.
Title: Spider-Man 3

Description: The magic of Percy Jackson somehow got lost - and not because of Pierce Brosnan missing as a centaur teacher. Pretty bad CGI, absence of all the Olympian Gods and also of any iconic scenes. I watched it and almost completely forgot about it right away, even if it was entertaining on a rather low level.
Title: Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters

Description: Lame one-liners, Silver Surfer is lame and even the return of Dr. Doom was very pathetic. Geez, I should rate this movie even more poorly.
Title: 4: Rise of the Silver Surfer

Description: Parodies Spider-Man and other movies, has very bad special effects and even worse fighting choreographies. But the shiny body is really impressive, it has incredibly funny scenes in combination with horrible actors and dialogues. Definitely worth a watch together with the right group of people.
Title: HK: Hentai Kamen

Description: A little confusing, because there isn't a Krrish 2 but hey. It definitely lost a lot of the first's charme but unfortunately nothing of its almost 3-hour-long runtime. Still like the characters, but the new villain is really lame and cliché with stupid world dominance plans paired with "destroy everything and kill all". Also his origin story is so lame, it wouldn't even have shocked anyone twenty years ago. Special effects are still trashy-cheesy, although some parts are really impressive (the face morphing of Kaya and  the scenes with Krisha and his father next to each other, which were played by the same actor) and the dancing flashmobs got way cooler.
Title: Krrish 3

Description: It had more of a golden thread than The New Mutants, that's for sure. And the Jim Carrey copycat acting as the villain was also fine with me. It could've been a solid movie, if the tight budget wouldn't have been that apparent all the time and if there were a lot less green and violet 90s lights.
Title: Generation X

Description: Cool idea, but it's one of the most dragging movies in this list. The splatter effects are okay at best, but at least there is a lot of them.
Title: Kick-Ass

Description: Catwoman with actual superpowers and embarrassing makeovers paired with bad CGI. Too much weird choreography & schizophrenia and too many cat puns - but much importantly: Not enough Catwoman.
Title: Catwoman

Description: Way too much slapstick, but it definitely has its moments (Xavier switching his wheelchairs), when you know what to expect. Lots of Spider-Man parodies, unfortunately not enough Batman or other heroes.
Title: Superhero Movie

Description: Written, directed and played by Trey Parker. you know, the South Park Trey Parker... And that's how you have to imagine the movie - no respect for any religion ever, lots of very stupid jokes that sometimes work, a little racism and the missing of Matt Stone to make it actually good. I'm sure this could've worked in an 20 or 30 minute episode of something but it had way too little content for a full length film - I was really wishing for it to be over after a while. Some gags were funny, but mostly because they were just over the top stupid. I think I prefer the stupidness of Hentai Kamen. Sorry, Trey.
Title: Orgazmo

Description: Ladies and Gentlemen, meet the best use of a cape in the entire genre. Also beside that, Spawn has not only a pretty cool costume but also very neat powers. When it comes to the movie itself, the quality unfortunately drops. Taking the revenge story from hell and the b-movie visuals it reminds me a lot of The Crow, only way worse - the dialogues are horrible, the action sequences long and boring and nothing really has any essence. This really could've gotten somewhere with a little more budget and an actual good writer. Still wondering how they got Martin Sheen for this... but the evil clown from hell with his The Mask powers who's quoting this and that was somewhat amusing.
Title: Spawn

Description: Well, the opening credits say it all: "Special Effects by Mr. Film" - if I would produce such "special effects" I too would use a pseudonym. What can I say? This movie was only produced to keep the Fantastic 4 rights some years longer and was denied to even exist. Even if there still are worse superhero movies out there, rightfully so. The acting is horrible, especially Dr. Doom's - he noticed that he can't use any facial expressions so he overuses gesticulations with every darn word he says. But in the end I'm pretty surprised how similar some of the scenes and dialogues were to the later reboot. P.S.: The Thing's rubber costume would perfectly fit into one of the old Turtles movies.
Title: The Fantastic Four

Description: Well, this certainly is on a level with Catwoman (especially when it comes to the uncomfortably tight sexy outfit)... Super boring first half, annoying flashbacks you don't care for, very little action, bad fight choreographies / cuts, but at least the CGI effects weren't too bad and the villains actually had cool powers.
Title: Elektra

Description: Ever watched a superhero movie without any special effects? Well, I did. Everyone is only talking about their powers but you never actually see them - they just talk about it. And they talk a lot. Standing there in their stupid (non-)costumes. It's not really funny, but still more enjoyayble than anything Ben Stiller ever did.
Title: The Specials

Description: Way. too. long! Batman kills, which is weird, Alfred looks like an old Robert Downey Jr., which is even weirder. Superman is boring, but we knew that all along and Lex Luthor is a Joker copy now. Well, at least we got the "Martha"-meme out of it.
Title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice

Description: The movie starts right away with a close-up of the costume nipples (even Mr. Freeze has them) and those horrible ice puns (although it's fascinating to see how many they could come up with) and way to cheesy one-liners. Furthermore it presents awful hectic cuts and even awfuler "special effects" - not to forget the way too handy gadgets like BatIceSkates... It's funny to see George Clooney of all people take the place of Val Kilmer while all other actors staying the same (Alfred, Robin). Also fun: The Lionel Luthor actor from Smallville as creator of Bane. Well, fun would be an exaggeration - the movie is pretty bad: The villain origin stories are almost comical, Mr. Freeze is a pathetic joke without any character, so is Bane. Uma Thurman as Poison Ivy is at least better than Thurman as Super Ex - that's something!
Title: Batman & Robin

Description: A Spanish parody on Superman which takes itself way too serious. There's a little slapstick in it, but nothing really funny and nothing over-the-top-naked-gun-like which would've fit very well seeing how close they copied the origin story. Visually it's not bad at all, but the CGI team never even heard of physics and apparently Mexico has all the beautiful Spanish women... The Japanese certainly do better superhero parodies.
Title: Superlópez

Description: Even Liam Neeson can't convince me in this movie without any superpowers. We just watch him 100 minutes switching faces to take revenge. Bruce Campbell at the end, cause the movie was done by Sam Raimi, saved at least one point in my rating.
Title: Darkman

Description: What is up with those horrible video transitions every 30 seconds?! Jeezus. The backstory is way too long and boring (but has a great Stan Lee & Lou Ferrigno Cameo) and I'm kind of missing a real villain here... instead I get mutant dogs that disappear in a cloud of green fairy dust. This movie is the constant thought of "When is it over?!".
Title: Hulk

Description: There isn't the slightest connection to DC - although the protagonist is a rich crime fighter skilled in all sports and fighting... The movie is full of unnecessary long and boring car chases, fights and underwater quarrels (of which they are apparently especially proud). The main enemy is a guy in a funny rubber suit, who's supposed to be a fishman made by a crazy scientist who extracts the juices of wrestlers. And I can't believe they actually poured oil into the ocean for a scene... anyway, the most entertaining thing about this movie are the comments on YouTube: "Her arch enemy should be The Poker", "Would love to go into her batcave", "I'd love for her to slide down by Batpole!" - if you have a "costume" like that (even Halle Berry's Catwoman wore more), that's what you get. Oh, and the crazy scientist's helper is names - of course - Igor!
Title: La mujer murcielago

Description: The actors sure have porn potential and the story isn't much better off. The soundtrack consists of elevator / mall music, the special effects are horrible and it doesn't make sense that the PUMAman flies - or that he can teleport for that matter. It's a pretty bad and boring movie - even sadder that it's not the worst one in this list...
Title: L'uomo puma
Genres: Action, Adventure, Family, Fantasy, Romance, Sci-Fi, Thriller

Description: It has a bad reputation and that rightfully so. It's a terrible movie with horrible CGI, based very very loosely on the manga. You have the names in there, Piccolo is green, but that's basically it. Goku and Bulma were casted Caucasian, while his grandfather, Yamcha, Chi-Chi and Muten Roshi are Asian, which was also kind of weird. Goku is an even skinnier boy than Venom was in Spider-Man 3 and he has just NOTHING of the real Goku. Instead, they turned his storyline into a teenie lovestory. Also there is way too little actual fighting. It's very obviously based on Dragonball (not Dragonball Z), where there still was real fighting and not so much energy balls shooting, where the Red Ribbon army was a huge interesting element and much of all the World Tournament... So, even if there is worse out there - it can't be a lot.
Title: Dragonball Evolution

Description: It's not really going anywhere, there isn't really anything happening in the whole movie... and the CGI effects are just so horrible. Ugh.
Title: Fantastic Four

Description: Not a big fan of Uma Thurman or pathetic origin stories like this. Basically all parts of this story are pathetic. It's also very uncomfortable to watch this control freak, even if it was intended to be funny. American low niveau humour at its best - or rather worst.
Title: My Super Ex-Girlfriend

Description: Ben Stiller is already enough reason to hate this movie, which at least got a lot of budget for its visuals. But taking everything together it really feels like a Spy Kids movie with way less stars in it, not a single good gag and a just completely stupid story. And Ben Stiller of course. Don't forget him.
Title: Mystery Men

Description: If you ever wanted to see a superhero movie filmed with a camera and absolutely no knowledge of film-making whatsoever - this is something for you. B-movie would be a way too generous term for this... the visual quality was horrible, the actors too - all 10 of them. There was basically no story and all scenes very so horribly wrong with at least 50.000 cuts missing in the scenes were literally nothing was happening and nobody was talking. Lots of scenes were repeated one-to-one in a movie of not even 90 minutes. Can't believe they put something like this on amazon prime... or anywhere. But the mask was funny - a Batman mask with the ears cut off, basically.
Title: Rise of the Black Bat
